title: Authors and Citation
text: Jacob T.N. Young. Maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Young JT (2025). SNACpack: Social Network Analysis Crime (Analysts). R package version 1.1.0.
code: @Manual{,   title = {SNACpack: Social Network Analysis for Crime (Analysts)},   author = {Jacob T.N. Young},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 1.1.0}, }

what: Social Network Analysis for Crime (Analysts) Package
title: Social Network Analysis for Crime (Analysts)
text: SNACpack package developed crime analysts criminologists conducting social network analysis (SNA). includes datasets helper functions used Social Network Analysis course Master Science Crime Analysis program Statistical Analysis Network Data (SAND) course Criminology Criminal Justice, PhD. courses taught School Criminology Criminal Justice Arizona State University.  SNACpack companion package books Social Network Analysis Crime Analysts Social Network Analysis Crime Analysts using R. former introductory textbook crime analysts learning SNA latter set tutorials show “” SNA RStudio.

title: Social Network Analysis for Crime (Analysts)
text: install SNACpack GitHub:
code: # install devtools (if not already installed) install.packages( "devtools" )    # install the package from the Github repository devtools::install_github( "jacobtnyoung/SNACpack" )

title: Social Network Analysis for Crime (Analysts)
text: SNACpack includes multiple networks user. data objects class network, need install network package.   Now, can look data objects. example, SNACpack includes data Mangia Natarajan’s study large cocaine trafficking organization New York City. network directed, binary ties communication individuals collected police wiretaps telephone conversations. network named cocaine_dealing_net.
code: # load the library for SNACpack library( SNACpack ) install.packages( "network" ) library( network ) # examine the help page for the network ?cocaine_dealing_net  # print it out to see the features cocaine_dealing_net

title: Social Network Analysis for Crime (Analysts)
text: encounter problem package suggestions improvement, please submit issue Github Issues page package. Thanks advance!

what: Add Pie Charts to Network Plot — add_pie
title: Add Pie Charts to Network Plot — add_pie
text: Adds pie charts nodes network plot visualize node attributes.

title: Add Pie Charts to Network Plot — add_pie
code: add_pie(x, p, sf, coord, cols, r = NULL, pielabel = NULL, ...)

title: Add Pie Charts to Network Plot — add_pie
text: x network object adjacency matrix. p matrix proportions slice (rows = slices, columns = nodes). sf Vertex scaling factor. coord matrix x y coordinates nodes. cols vector matrix colors pie slices. r Optional radius pie chart (default sf/10). pielabel Optional list arguments pie.labels(). ... Additional arguments passed gplot().

title: Add Pie Charts to Network Plot — add_pie
text: network plot pie charts added nodes.

title: Cocaine Dealing Network — cocaine_dealing_net
text: Natarajan, M. (2006). Understanding structure large heroin distribution network: quantitative analysis qualitative data. *Journal Quantitative Criminology*, 22(2), 171–192. https://doi.org/10.1007/s10940-006-9000-6

code: data( directed_example_net ) sna::gplot( directed_example_net ) #> Error in sna::gplot(directed_example_net): Error in gplot: no layout function for mode fruchtermanreingold # coerce to a matrix as.matrix( directed_example_net ) #>      Jen Tom Bob Leaf Jim #> Jen    0   1   0    0   0 #> Tom    0   0   1    0   0 #> Bob    0   0   0    1   1 #> Leaf   0   0   1    0   1 #> Jim    0   0   1    1   0

title: London Gang Network — london_gang_net
text: one-mode network 54 individuals represented `network` object.

title: London Gang Network — london_gang_net
text: `network` object 54 nodes 315 edges.

title: London Gang Network — london_gang_net
text: Data retrieved http://www.casos.cs.cmu.edu/tools/datasets/external/index.php

title: London Gang Network — london_gang_net
text: network represents co-offending among London-based inner-city street gang, 2005-2009. Data comes anonymized police arrest conviction data "confirmed" members gang. Vertex attributes: - `Age`: Age - `Birthplace`: Birthplace (1 = West Africa, 2= Caribbean, 3= UK, 4= East Africa) - `Residence`: Residence - `Arrests`: Number arrests - `Convictions`: Number convictions - `Prison`: prison - `Music`: Type music

title: London Gang Network — london_gang_net
text: Grund, T. Densley, J. (2015). Ethnic homophily triad closure: Mapping internal gang structure using exponential random graph models. *Journal Contemporary Criminal Justice*, 31(3), 354–370. https://doi.org/10.1177/1043986215594291

title: London Gang Network — london_gang_net
code: data( london_gang_net ) sna::gplot( london_gang_net ) #> Error in sna::gplot(london_gang_net): Error in gplot: no layout function for mode fruchtermanreingold

title: Paul Revere Conspiracy Network — paul_revere_net
text: `network` object 261 nodes (254 individuals 7 events) 334 edges.

title: Paul Revere Conspiracy Network — paul_revere_net
text: Paul Revere conspiracy dataset concerns relationships people affiliations different organizations Boston. dataset refers Paul Revere, responsible organizing local militia Boston's revolutionary movement (see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sons_of_Liberty). dataset analysed Kieran Healy Duke University. dataset reconstructed looking information presented appendix book "Paul Revere's Ride" published David Fischer (1994). Vertex attributes: - `names`: Name individuals locations

title: Paul Revere Conspiracy Network — paul_revere_net
text: Fischer, D. (1994). "Paul Revere's Ride", Oxford University Press. http://www.casos.cs.cmu.edu/tools/datasets/external/paulrevere/

title: Philippine Kidnappings Network — philippine_kidnappings_net
text: two-mode network individuals events represented `network` object.

title: Philippine Kidnappings Network — philippine_kidnappings_net
text: `network` object 351 nodes (246 individuals 105 events) 402 edges.

title: Philippine Kidnappings Network — philippine_kidnappings_net
text: Data refers Abu Sayyaf Group (ASG), violent non-state actor operating Southern Philippines. particular, data related Salast movement founded Aburajak Janjalani, native terrorist Southern Philippines 1991. ASG active kidnapping kinds terrorist attacks (Gerdes et al. 2014). reconstructed 2-mode matrix combines terrorist kidnappers terrorist events attended. Vertex attributes: - `vertex.names`: Name individuals locations

title: Philippine Kidnappings Network — philippine_kidnappings_net
text: Gerdes, L. M., Ringler, K., Autin, B. (2014). "Assessing Abu Sayyaf Group's Strategic Learning Capacities." Studies Conflict & Terrorism 37, . 3: 267-293. http://www.tandfonline.com/eprint/cCV3RJihmG3miPFECpV7/full
